results.title: The Voice of Ivan Frost
results.creator_credit: Alanya Van De Wiel, Paul Fletcher, Robert Stephenson, Ann Shenfield and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: In a surreal industrial landscape populated by equally bizarre characters, the magical voice of celebrated singer Ivan Frost has the power to make people wish for death. In a remote village elsewhere, Alfonso Pellegrini, a shepherd with an astonishing musical talent, longs to leave his sheep and go in search of the fabulous sounds described in books. Being invited to play beside the remarkable singer, Alfonso is saddened to find himself thrust into the background, his precious violin broken from trying to compete for attention. Ivan’s world is similarly turned upside down when he awakens to find his voice gone and a scar across his chest. Without his legendary voice to bewitch the masses and open doors for him, he is forced to confront the nightmarish reality of his situation - alone.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alanya Van De Wiel, Paul Fletcher, Robert Stephenson, Ann Shenfield and Victorian College of the Arts

results.title: The Voice of Agriculture
results.creator_credit: Tony Doogood and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture, this short film is an advertisement for the radio broadcast “The Voice of Agriculture”. Typical of the (now outdated) representation of gender roles of the time, the film opens with a domestic scene in which the mother of the family is making dinner while her husband discusses farm work. The farmer, who is having trouble with his sheep, calls on professional help from a veterinarian at the Department of Agriculture, who informs him about the radio program “The Voice of Agriculture”, which is designed to help farmers like him. The film then shows the behind-the-scenes production of the broadcast, including voice actors, radio technicians and vintage wireless sets.

results.title: The Vital signs and their inter-relation: body temperature, pulse, respiration, blood pressure
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids and Willard Pictures
results.brief_description:
A study of the physiology of the respiratory, heat regulatory, and circulatory systems, and their inter-relation in normal functioning, as well as in deviations from the normal. How to ascertain and record the vital signs, the importance of making thorough and accurate observations, and how to take care of the apparatus necessary for these observations, is demonstrated.
Designed for use in the instruction of professional nurses.

results.title: The Vital link
results.creator_credit: W. J. Allen, M.J. Clark and Rank Audio Visual
results.brief_description: Examines the development of transport routes, how the preferred means of transport is usually a compromise between convenience, speed and cost and some of the problems caused by an ever increasing dependence on transport in our everyday lives.

results.title: The Vital conductor
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Quantum”.
This is the second program in Quantum’s occasional series ‘The Universe within’, featuring Karina Kelly and Geoffrey Burchfield. It describes the function performed by the liver and looks at its ability to regenerate.
